dataIdInfo.idAbs: The XML to SDE Workspace tool extends the Create SDE Workspace tool. It creates a new enterprise (SDE) geodatabase using the name of the XML Workspace file to name the new SDE workspace and loads all the data from the XML Workspace file into the new SDE workspace. Similar to the File to SDE Workspace tool, it implements the Create SDE Workspace tool, creating a new enterprise geodatabase with a data owner connection used to load the data from the XML Workspace file.

tool.name: SdeFromXmlTool

param.name: xmlFile
param.dialogReference:
Please specify the input xml workspace file.

This file must have been created by exporting from a geodatabse. Although the tool will allow you to specify any xml file as input, it will fail unless this truly is an xml workspace file cread by right clicking on a geodatabse and selecting Export > XML Workspace Document

param.name: instance
param.dialogReference:
On what machine intance does the database management system reside?

This defaults to the local machine name since many times this script is used for setting up a database on a test or demonstration machine. However, if your database server resides on a different machine than where the script is being run, this will need to be changed accordingly.

param.name: dbms
param.dialogReference:
On what machine intance does the database management system reside?

This defaults to the local machine name since many times this script is used for setting up a database on a test or demonstration machine. However, if your database server resides on a different machine than where the script is being run, this will need to be changed accordingly.

param.name: suName
param.dialogReference:
What is the database management system superuser name?

This will autopopulate based on the DBMS selected above. Typically these defaults will work. In some instaces this may have to be changed.

param.name: suPswd
param.dialogReference: What is the database managment system superuser password?

param.name: ownerName
param.dialogReference:
What is the data owner's login name going to be?

If this user already exists, specify this existing user. If database authentication is supported and the user does not already exist, the user will be created.

param.name: ownerPswd
param.dialogReference:
What is the data owner's password going to be?

If the above specified data owner already exists, this will need to be the correct password. If the data owner does not already exist, this will set the password for the new user.

param.name: authFile
param.dialogReference:
What is the path to the keycodes file?

This defaults to the location where the file should be found. However, if the server is on a different machine, this may have to be specified in a different location.

tool.summary: The XML to SDE Workspace tool extends the Create SDE Workspace tool. It creates a new enterprise (SDE) geodatabase using the name of the XML Workspace file to name the new SDE workspace and loads all the data from the XML Workspace file into the new SDE workspace. Similar to the File to SDE Workspace tool, it implements the Create SDE Workspace tool, creating a new enterprise geodatabase with a data owner connection used to load the data from the XML Workspace file.
